H0.text: Burned in a fire is why a tree is considered a renewable resource, because it can be burned in a fire.

H1.text: Made into lumber is why a tree is considered a renewable resource.

H2.text: Eaten by some organisms is what makes a tree a renewable resource because it can be consumed by certain organisms.

H3.text: Replaced with a newly planted tree is why a tree is considered a renewable resource.

A4.text: wood provided by means of forestry, which has been used for firewood since ancient times.

A5.text: wood provided by means of forestry, which has been used for construction and housing since ancient times.

A6.text: trees are planted to replace those that have been cut, much like other crops.

A7.text: the Finnish Forest Act from 1996 requires that forest be replanted after felling.
